channel.title: Unlimited X-Chat Use
channel.description:
If you've downloaded X-Chat from their official website as a Windows build, you will notice that the software will no longer 'work' after 30-days due to the trial period expiring. Fortunately, the developers were silly enough to just check how many days X-Chat has been installed via a registry key:
[code]HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\XChat\installed[/code]
To remove this key without opening regedit every 30-days, simply use: [code]REG DELETE HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\XChat /va /f[/code]
The key's value doesn't seem to be a unix timestamp, but if someone was to figure out what the data's format is - one could most likely create a date that is far into the future to have a proper fix.

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That actually does look like it could be better than X-Chat 2. I’ll have to test it next time I get on windows.

On a somewhat related note, does anyone know if X-Chat builds with gcc+cygwin on windows? That might really be the way to do it.

item.title: Unlimited X-Chat Use
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:42, topic:402188”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=499241.msg3675603#msg3675603 date=1311223857]

Like this?

That’s nothing special, not any better than mIRC interface. I changed mine to be similar in a few seconds with no scripting: http://i.imgur.com/mcugz.png
Of course, you could change font and colors if you have problems with those. But if you like scripting stuff for IRC, which I don’t, I suppose mIRC would be annoying.
[/quote]I heard someone once made an IRC server in purely MSL.

Iirc Imk0tter made an ASM interpreter or something in MSL.[/quote]
TBH someone should make one in GML!!!111

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited X-Chat Use
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

cumescape:

You have to pay for X-Chat? Another great reason to use irssi for Windows.

GOD NO. I did that for a little while. So awful when I was trying to make/run scripts. With the addition of perl being gay as hell, it was an overall terrible experience.
Don’t know why a windows user would be against mIRC unless they didn’t want to pay for it or crack it… but whatever. I’d avoid using cygwin when possible though.

Read full topic

[/quote]
because running through cygwin is the best solution.[/quote]
